boofcv.alg.feature.detect.interest
Class FeatureScaleSpace<T extends ImageSingleBand,D extends ImageSingleBand>

java.lang.Object
  boofcv.alg.feature.detect.interest.FeatureScaleSpace<T,D>
All Implemented Interfaces:
InterestPointScaleSpace<T,D>
public class FeatureScaleSpace<T extends ImageSingleBand,D extends ImageSingleBand>
extends java.lang.Object
implements InterestPointScaleSpace<T,D>

Detects scale invariant interest/corner points by computing the feature intensities across a pyramid of different scales. Features which are maximums with in a local 2D neighborhood and within the local scale neighbourhood are declared to be features.

NOTE: Features are not computed for the bottom and top most layers in the pyramid.

[1] Krystian Mikolajczyk and Cordelia Schmid, "Indexing based on scale invariant interest points" ICCV 2001. Proceedings.
[2] Lindeberg, T., "Feature detection with automatic scale selection." IJCV 30(2) (1998) 79 â€“ 116

Author:
Peter Abeles
See Also:
FactoryInterestPoint

Constructor Detail

FeatureScaleSpace

public FeatureScaleSpace(GeneralFeatureDetector<T,D> detector,
                         double scalePower)
Create a feature detector.

Parameters:
detector - Point feature detector which is used to find candidates in each scale level
scalePower - Used to adjust feature intensity in each level to make them comparable. Feature dependent, but most common features should use a value of 2.
